Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: John C
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel DaBruno over Easter 2012 and were delighted with our room and the friendliness of the staff. The hotel was very clean, the bed comfortable and the hot shower very welcome. The hotel itself is very quiet, but our room looked out into the street and obviously there was a lot of noise from the passersby, however once the windows, and most importantly the shutters were closed it was nice and quiet. The fridge and safe were very nice comforts. The breakfast was very good and with the high prices in Venice, it set you up for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel & value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Carolynn M
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed 8 nights at this hotel in March 2012. It more than met my expectations: Room: Pretty, clean, with a good bathroom, strong flush to toilet (yes! this can be an important aspect of a good room). Bed: firm which I love. Hated the pillow but then does anybody like a pillow that is not his/her own? The only improvement could be that the ceiling fan in the bathroom needs dusting. An added benefit was that there was a computer where people like myself not travelling with a computer etc. could use to check email. Thin walls, but all other guests were very quiet so no problem. Some noise from street but that can't be helped. Breakfast: Wonderful selection - rolls, pastries, cheese, salami, granola, cereal, milk, juice, fruit bowl, yogurt, jams, melba toasts/crackers etc. Everything was fresh. A great way to start the day. Staff: Reserved but always, always, always polite and pleasant. If you ask for help it was forthcoming and excellent. Location: Location! Location! Location! - It couldn't have been placed better being half way between the Rialto Bridge and San Marco Square. Also, with their map it is easy to find.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, very nice staff!”
Reviews.Author: Roberto C
Reviews.Content: We were at this hotel for two nights a couple of days ago, the location was very good, the room was great and the breakfast was good too, it is probably the best hotel we have been on our trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: FoodFollower
Reviews.Content: We caught a water taxi from Venice airport to Venice central (worth the 110 euros for an amazing first look at Venice). We were dropped off fairly close to the hotel and it was an easy walk. The hotel is within a 5 min walk of the major attractions. The room was tastefully decorated and looked out onto the main street below. the bathroom was very small, but functioned well. Free wifi was great. Breakfast was average, but there are so many great places tp buy espresso and pastries that we ended up skipping the included breakfast at the hotel and venturing outside. Front desk were very helpful with directions to restaurants, bookings, and our onward journey.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Cozy and Great Price”
Reviews.Author: cruisepaige
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night as part of a tour of Italy. I was not feeling well and the clerk gave me a big glass of orange juice when I checked in. I then took a nap in a big comfy bed (I was in the room with the ceilingbeams)and too ka hot bath in a big deep bathtub. The room was nice and warm and it was a riany November. Then I went tothe Opera. It was lovely to come back to after my walk though a quiet and indescribably beautiful midnight Venice. This place is near the Rialto bridge and near everything--little shops, pharmacies, restaurants galore, tons of little piazzas and like a 3 min walk to St. Mark's. I booked it after reading some reviews here and it EXCEEDED my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Footsteps in Venice in Winter”
Reviews.Author: MG050211
Reviews.Content: We visited Venice just before Christmas. We didn't actually stay in Hotel da Bruno but stayed in an apartment rented out by the hotel. The staff at Hotel da Bruno welcomed us as soon as we arrived offered us a capuccino and showed us to the apartment down a quiet quaint alleyway, The apartment Corte del Dose was centrally located between Rialto and St Mark's square but tucked conveniently away from the hustle and bustle. The sunny yellow and cream apartment is decorated in venetian style and you enter it via a charmingcourtyard. The aparment was small clean and comfortable with and open plan sitting room and dining area with a small kitchen. The apartment was next to a canal and we enjoyed views of the canal from both the lounge and bedroom. We enjoyed eating our breakfast and watching the gondaliers and other water craft go about their daily business. The staff at the hotel da bruno were extremely helpful advising on restaurants, and helping with theatre and concert bookings. We definitely recommend the apartment and the hotel da bruno for a romantic trip to venice. Try venice in the winter its not crowed and most romantic ... its so quite down some alleyways all you hear are own footsteps

Reviews.Title: “Where is in Europe is B-fast included!”
Reviews.Author: J V
Reviews.Content: After being on the road in Europe for a week, this place was such a relief. As soon as we entered the hotel room the customer service was exceptional. They sat us down, made me a mocha and my wife a cappuccino and took our bags during the entire check in process. Breakfast was included (it's nice to find a place in Europe where you don't have to worry if they're ripping you off or spend 1 hour looking for a decent place for breakfast). We stayed in mid-January and it was only $60 -70 a night. I'm sure in Venice like any other city, prices skyrocket during the warmer months so I would book ahead. The room was really nice, clean, comfortable and needed everything you need. The location was in the center of it all. Check it out here http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FH0TqgVEkG0

Reviews.Title: “Great location and feels like a Venetian house”
Reviews.Author: Christine R
Reviews.Content: Great location! We took an Alilaguna (water bus) from Marco Polo airport to our hotel. If you get off at San Marco station, this hotel is only 5 minutes walk away. The hotel is also only a few minutes walk from St Mark's Basilica and St Mark's square which is really convenient. If you plan to get off at San Marco station, it will be difficult to drag heavy luggage around. There are quite a few steps and since the Rialto bridge and St. Mark's is nearby, there will be large crowds of tourists. The hotel interior is beautiful as it feels very Venetian, like an old Venetial mansion. However, the room walls are quite thin so you can hear your neighbors if they talk loud. The hotel does not have an elevator but that should not matter as the concierge is really helpful when bringing your things up to your room. The staff at the front desk make you feel at home and are polite and friendly. They can also give you some tips on things to do in Venice. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Very Central locatuon in Venice”
Reviews.Author: ReidyNSW
Reviews.Content: Ideally positioned between San Marco and the Rialto Bridge and in the middle of masses of shopping, coffee, gellato and food. The staff were great and the free wi fi worked really well. The only trouble we had was the hot water boiler broke down and we had to hwve a cold shower on the coldest day of our trip to Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near the Rialto Bridge! Yay Igor!”
Reviews.Author: vancouvermum
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here after a friend recommended it to me. Nice room, very good shower, and excellent info on Venice provided by Igor. Centrally located for prowling the San Marco neighbourhood in Venice AND a free shuttle to the island of Murano. It was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Ca D'Oro apartment in great location!”
Reviews.Author: pegjohnson
Reviews.Content: Two couples spent three nights at Ca D'Oro apartment run by the Hotel Da Bruno. Paolo met us at the S. Apostoli campo, took us to the apartment, which is spacious with all the amenities, 2 bdr, 2 bath with showers. Then, he took us to show us a bit of the Canareggio neighborhood and to dinner at a great place (can't remember the name) but Max waited on us and we had a fabulous meal. We were minutes from the Ca D'Oro vaporetto and from the Rialto bridge, so we could wander without trouble. The apartment (one of many Da Bruno owns, was perfect for us. I especially loved being on the S. Apostoli canal and loved hearing the boats go by. This is definitely the place for two couples or a family. There was a pull out bed in the living room, as well.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Yet Nice”
Reviews.Author: BOC68
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Hotel Da Bruno the first week of September. The hotel is a small, modest hotel, but is immaculate. We had a triple room that was quite large by Venitian standards. The staff are helpful and accommodating. Considering the cost of lodging in Venice the hotel was a comparative bargain. We booked through Hotels.com and received notification of a price reduction which worked out nicely. Although close to the Rialto vaparetto stop, the 5 or 6 blocks to the hotel can be difficult if you have a lot of luggage. It is within convenient walking distance of most of the main sights. The hotel also offers a computer station on each floor with free internet. This proved very helpful in confirming subsequent hotel and airline reservations. If you decide to take a gondola ride, we would suggest getting one from near the Santa Maria Formosa church area (a couple of blocks behind the Da Bruno) rather than the Rialto bridge area. Although the hotel staff sugested taking a gondola from Rialto, it proved to be crowded, noisy and the gondaliers seemed to be in a rush to get you in and out as soon as possible. There is a restaurant directly across from the Da Bruno that was good and reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC for Carnival”
Reviews.Author: debbie b
Reviews.Content: I found Hotel da Bruno on TA and was apprehensive. The staff e-mailed me several times before my trip and was incredibly helpful with porter and vaporetto arrangements.Their English was excellent. I was thrilled with my 4th floor room (no elevator). The value of this hotel was amazing. It is minutes from St. Marks. Staff was very friendly, helpful and breakfast was terrific. I will go back again for Carnival and stay at this WONDERFUL hotel. (The bathroom was a little tiny but it was an excellent price)

Reviews.Title: “Comfort in the bustling Venetian world”
Reviews.Author: Trixta
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights before moving on to a cruise on the Med. Arrived from England, and were met with a smile and the famous fruit juice which is so welcome after the outside heat. Room was ready, smallish, but totally met our needs. Great bed, cosy shower, quiet room and was a welcome respite from our walking and sightseeing in this eyeopening city. Breakfast was normal continental style, but certainly ample, fresh and abundant. Manager and wife very helpful, and also threw in a free trip to Murane Island (probably as a sales teaser for the glass works there). Returning from this was fun as we just got on the public transport and went to Buranop then back. Location of the Da Bruno is great - very close to many shops and restaurants, if you want just a snack and beer, or full restaurant service. Arranging water taxi to cruise ship was done by the Hotel, and carriage of luggae a short distance to the Taxi was done with a smile. Great experience. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Tidy, Slighty Lacking Atmosphere.”
Reviews.Author: HogansApprentice
Reviews.Content: Great location, extremely clean throughout, air con in room poor -not cold & just about a mild breeze, excellent bathroom & shower, average decor, mini bar, firm bed, staff generally miserable, 3rd floor small attic room, no lift, excellent breakfast, overall 6.5, would probably try somewhere different next time, but could have been alot worse.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: tw0aussies
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Hotel Da Bruno after a cancelled flight and a day at Paris airport to find friendly staff who were extremely attentive. They took our bags to our room, recommended restaurants, things to do (and booked them!)... Paolo was particularly helpful. The hotel was in a great location, a short walk to the main square but far enough away from the hustle and bustle. The room (suite) was very spacious and had everything we needed. The hotel organised a great trip to Morano to see the glass blowing, which was a great experience. This was a one of the highlights from our honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: cdnands
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a quad room, the beds were sufficient but the washroom was tiny and cramped. There was no elevator and the breakfast was average. Definitely a budget hotel. Front desk staff were very friendly, helpful and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location and price”
Reviews.Author: likeeat
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at da Bruno before, but in the past I guess my room was not in the front of the building: the room I had this time, overlooking the street, was very noisy. But that's my only gripe. The staff are knowledgeable and friendly, the location is right between the Rialto and P. San Marco, and the price is very affordable for Venice. Plus there is free breakfast and WiFi.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic - thank you Igor.”
Reviews.Author: reisey
Reviews.Content: We had the best time staying in the best hotel. Igor and the staff were absolutely wonderful. It was the best location, so central. Close to Rialto Bridge and San Marco square. Breakfast was just wonderful each morning. With trusty map from the hotel in hand, we would head off each day. It was the trip of a lifetime and I certainly will be returning. The shopping was fabulous and plenty of room in our hotel rooms to store the bags at the end of each day. Wanted to stay much longer. I will definately be back. Thank you Igor for listening to our stories at the end of each day. You were wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect: Awesome Location, Brilliant Hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: BipulShukla
Reviews.Content: I would rate the hotel perfect 5 stars primarily due to: - Its wonderfully located, 5 minutes walking from Rialto Bridge and 10 mins walking from St. Mark's Square. - On the hotel website, you get exact way how to reach the hotel when travelling by a train (like we did) arriving at Venezia Santa Lucia. Take Water Taxi No.2 and get down at Rialto Bridge - then follow the way described on the hotel website. - Upon reception, the guy checked us immediately in the room, carried our luggage to the room, gave us the username&password for free wi-fi internet. - Then he gave us ample information and Venice map for the best-affordable&expensive restaurants serving the best pizza-pasta in Venice :) - The hotel receptionist also booked our Venice Walking Tour (we paid cash at the hotel counter for the tour starting at St. Marks Square) - So far, the reception and the service has been the best among all the European cities that I have visited (Paris, Swiss, Mallorca etc.) - The room was perfect for a size of 2 (considering we were in the mazes of Venice): Air Conditioner maintained the temperature to right levels in an otherwise 30+degrees outside. There was a safe with a key provided free of cost. Regular stuff such as mini-bar, TV, hair dryer & toiletries were present. - Breakfast was decent, no complains. - I repeat the location is just fab ---> As this is the main island of Venice and everything is so easily approachable. Dont miss out buying some masks at umpteen number of shops around, enjoy coffee on the canal bank sides, enjoy gelatino ice creams (they r yum) and dont forget the Gondola Ride - It adds on to the experience...... It was my first wedding anniversary and I couldnt have asked for anything better :) Cheers.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near Rialto bridge”
Reviews.Author: drdmromeo
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Hotel da Bruno, conveniently located near the Rialto Bridge. The service was terrific, Igor and the others were all friendly and very helpful to us during our stay. Our room was very clean and quiet, we had a triple and were located at the very top of the hotel. Very good and filling free breakfast. We would recommend to all, and will return next time we visit Vwnice

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in the centre of Venice”
Reviews.Author: David-Reviews
Reviews.Content: Although our room was small, it was well designed to make good use of the space and provided good facilities including en suite, air conditioning and a fridge. Hotel was extremely clean and the buffet breakfast was excellent. The location is ideal for a short break and very convenient for sight-seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great charm and views of the canals....”
Reviews.Author: FTello
Reviews.Content: We found it quite easily following the maps and the lovely lady, Francesca at reception got us all a cool drink to cool down. We were delighted to be upgraded to the apartment suite and the kids were excited by the sensational views from every room.. Service was great and staff very friendly. We would definately come back again!! The aircondioning worked a treat as we were there during very humid days.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: justmesk49
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel for it's location. The room we had was large , and had a shower and a corner tub...wonderful! The staff was helpful and courteous, Was nice to be able to have a bit of breakfast each morning too

Reviews.Title: “Location perfect”
Reviews.Author: Leon1630
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few years ago arrived late and most restraunts were closed but the hotel fixed us up a snack. Very friendly staff. But the best thing was the location 2 mins from the Rialto bridge and 2 mins the other way was San marc square. Will be back.

Reviews.Title: “fair enough”
Reviews.Author: mixiechick
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel in a great location between the Rialto bridge and St Mark's square, so was a short walk to each. Rooms small, but adequete. Bathroom very small! We found the heating was blaring in the rooms through the night and there was not anyway to control the temperature in the room. The breakfast choices were great and varied, with something for everyone. We felt the owners/workers were not overly friendly however, and when we once came back at 11pm and asked if we could order some drinks from the bar we were redirected to the mini bar in the room!! No sky tv as advertised! All in all I would be tempted to see what other hotel options there were before opting for Da Bruno

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Divegirl44
Reviews.Content: Hotel da Bruno was selected based on reviews from TripAdvisor and, as usual, the reviews were spot on. Fantastic location just a 3-4 minute walk from the Rialto Bridge, that is if you walk straight through without stopping at one of the several gelato shops, restaurants or clothing stores. The rooms are not large, but are quite comfortable...after all, how much time are you going to spend in your room? Breakfast is tasty, bountiful and will keep you going all day. I'll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: oldrob86
Reviews.Content: The room was not expansive but everything else about the Hotel Da Bruno was terrific. Great location, wonderful helpful staff & everything worked.

Reviews.Title: “Best accomodations and location in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Cuddles1949
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with another couple just returned from a 2 night stay at Hotel Da Bruno. Directions from the train station could not have been easier. Located 5 min. from Rialto Bridge and 5 mins from St. Mark's Square, this hotel is situated on a beautiful street with shopping and restaurants galore. The interior is beautiful, adorned with mirrors and lighting made in Murano. Our room and bath were immaculate and we had 2nd floor room #260 - no view per say, but totally soundproofed. We also had a lounge area outside our room for drinking wine and relaxing. Free internet, exceptional breakfast with freshly made coffee (not machine coffee), and courteous staff were definite bonuses. We want to thank "Igor", an exceptional front desk clerk, for making our stay most enjoyable and our touring of Venice a breeze with his suggestions and directions. He definitely went beyond giving great Customer service. Having been our first time in Venice, we hit the jackpot with this hotel and will definitely return some day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Merran97
Reviews.Content: Hotel da Bruno was great. The service was excellent, the hotel clean as was the room and breakfast the usual fare. Save your euros for other things such as the shopping!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: RogerExmouth
Reviews.Content: This is a super small hotel, well placed for the Rialto and St Mark's Square. The room was a surpisingly good size for Venice, very clean and comfortable. The servicing of the room was excellent, with clean towels every day. The breakfast is the usual continental buffet, with a good choice of foods. Staff were all friendly and efficient. We would not hesitate to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced accommodation in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: IrelandIrisheyes
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 1 night and was very pleased with the accommodation. It is situated between the Rialto bridge and St. Mark's square. On arrival at the hotel the receptionist was very friendly and provided us with fruit juices - really appreciated this after carrying heavy cases from the vaporetta stop in 30 degree temperatures !! He checked us in very quickly and carried my case to the room. I could not fault the room. It had air conditioning, a safe, a mini bar. The breakfast was adequate with the usual supply of juices, cereals, meats, cheeses etc. The rate for 1 night was 120 euro for 2 persons which I found very reasonable for Venice. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the city.

Reviews.Title: “Received Excellent Service!!!”
Reviews.Author: trip-4-2-td
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at Hotel Da Bruno for 2 nights in Venice during our 2-week Italy adventure. Not only was the location ideal and rooms clean, but the service was out of this world!! The entire staff was great but there was one particular staff, Igor, at the front desk. He was so friendly. He recommended a nearby restaurant for dinner and because he called them, we got free champagne. He also recommended a couple great gelato places. We needed to change our museum ticket reservations for Florence (our next stop) and we couldn't get connected on our phone so he made the call for us. He had to stay on the phone forever but he did it gladly and joked about the music that he heard on the other end. He also threw in free internet access when there was a charge so we were able to book accommodations for our next two stops. He made our stay very pleasant! The breakfast was great and it really was the ideal accommodation. Thanks for making our honeymoon special!

Reviews.Title: “stranded in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: windsorlady04
Reviews.Content: We were stranded in Venice for an extra 6 days due to the volcanic ash cloud. The staff of the Da Bruno were absolutely superb, they made us feel very welcome and helped us to arrange our journey home by train! We were very worried about the situation but were never made to feel unwelcome. The hotel was in a great location , breakfast was delicious and the rooms very clean. If we had to be stranded anywhere we couldn't have chosen a more friendly place to be. Many thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff, wonderful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ObviousOrange
Reviews.Content: I don't think I have anything nicer to say about any hotel that I've stayed at. Hotel Da Bruno impressed us right from the first step inside their doors. We decided after a long train ride that we would walk to our hotel (Note: it's not really near the train station). We were tired and cranky from the lack of sleep, train ride, walking, and it was warm that day so by the time we got to the hotel we must have looked pitiful and tired. We walked to the counter where we were greeted by a very polite and helpful desk clerk. He looked at us and walked way. At first I thought "great, another rude desk clerk" but to my surprise he came back with two glasses of fresh orange juice and offered them to us. He then proceeded to check us in. He apologized for the lack of elevator and offered to help us with our backs to our room (we declined, it was only one flight of stairs), but the fact that he offered was above and beyond what we expected. The hotel was quite, clean, in a great location, and the staff were incredibly helpful and courteous. The room was a decent size - small, but functionable and certainly not out of place from the rest of Europe. There was a nice sitting area on each floor with access to a computer, a printer, and the internet. The hotel itself would have been enough for me to give it four or five stars, but the extras that came with it -- the friendly staff, the way we were greeted and the attention paid highlight top notch customer service. If I could give this hotel ten stars I would and if I'm ever in Venice again I will definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “spotlessly clean hotel in a superb location”
Reviews.Author: isabellamalta
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of its great location - just minutes from the two main attractions. We arrived late at night so it was a relief to find that the instructions were very clear. The reception area was very welcoming and the receptionist spoke very good english. The rooms are basic and small but what matteres to us is that they were spotlessly clean. The cold buffet breakfast had a good choice and was very filling although the coffee wasn't as hot as i liked it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location...”
Reviews.Author: FrenchMaid2009
Reviews.Content: ...all that you see on their website is what you get - fantastic service - a member of staff was always on reception, ready to help with anything - spotlessly clean hotel and room (the room was small - but you are only in there for a short while...too much to see in Venice!), breakfast was wonderful - lots to choose from. Every member of staff that we met was very helpful. The directions on their website were excellent - we arrived late at night and didn't like the idea of wondering around Venice on our own...BUT the directions got us there within a short time and they were accurate. Buy the Valperetto (water taxi) ticket as soon as you get off the bus...saves you so much money and you can hop on and off these taxi's whenever you like. The hotel is situated in a small, busy street (all streets in Venice are small!) and you can hear people from early morning (getting their shops ready for customers etc)...but it's LOVELY to hear the locals talking and it adds to the ambience of being in Venue...no cars thundering up the street - just people talking! Don't get caught out by sitting outside the cafes anywhere in Venice...you are likely to be charged almost twice the price that is advertised on the menu!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: pjbak
Reviews.Content: we just got back from a stay at the Bruno on October 1 2009. Excellent location and great service from Igor at the front desk. Very helpful on arranging a water taxi to the hotel and inquiries.Rooms basic and small, but adequate. The location between the Rialto and St. Mark,s square is perfect. Breakfast was again typical of Venice and the service was good. Overall we would suggest this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marathin1959
Reviews.Content: Our triple room cannot be termed as spacious but ok , I guess thats how it must be in venice hotels. The attached bathroom was just too tiny. However everything , like the shower etc. worked and was clean. Our room was on the first floor facing a narrow lane. One could hear a bit of noise occassionally. Late at night we could hear a loud birthday party held at the restaurant just below. thankfully it did not go on for too long. The staff was helpful when asked for information. The cold buffet breakfast was filling. The location was good, a five minute walk from the Ponte Rialto, even then we got lost, the first day while getting to the hotel. But that is venice! There were restaurants and convenience shops just down the hotel lane. Our room floor actuallly convinced us that Venice is indeed sinking. It was sloping a bit to one side.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: allihies
Reviews.Content: Stayed at da Bruno for 3 nights in June and have absolutely no complaints. Room was small, like all in Venice, and unusually had no view. However it was very comfortable and was spotlessly clean. Bathroom was good size, good shower, spotless. A/c worked well. Breakfast was adequate, continental and charming Carmello remembered that I liked my coffee hot! Lovely person who greeted you each morn, thank you Carmello. I found the staff very helpful especially Igor at reception. All staff were helpful, /antonio, porter also. Found hotel hard to find on the 1st day but wasnt long getting orientated. Its situated in a shopping area. I would have no problem recommending hotel, standard venice hotel with very helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “It felt like home; I didn't want to leave”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler120
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel; from the minute I entered until I left I felt comfortable and welcome. Igor was on duty with a glass of orange juice on a tray for me when I checked in. His English is perfect and he was very helpful--in fact, every staff member was polite, friendly and helpful. My room, a single, was a little small compared to what we are used to in the U.S., but perfectly adequate for me (about 7ft by 12 ft). (Everything in Venice is small, even the dogs.) The decor was very pleasant--marble floor, gold brocade bedspread, red velvet trim on the headboard, and a chandelier. I had a desk, small TV, a small refrigerator, and a wardrobe. There was even a little wall safe. The windows opened for fresh air. The bathroom was surprisingly modern and spotless with a large sink and shower with very good water pressure. It was very quiet (my room was in the back.) In the early morning I could hear some dogs barking and seagulls squawking, but only because I had opened the window. It's always nice to hear the church bells. The breakfast buffet incuded juices, fruit, cereals, pastries and bread, ham, cheese, tomatoes and olives. The very friendly wait staff serve coffee or tea as soon as you sit down. Even though I had a great map, I got lost twice on the way to the hotel, but that is so common in Venice. The location is great; it is less than 5 minutes to Rialto and less than 10 minutes to St. Mark's Square. There are 3 gelato shops within 1/2 block, and a great restaurant right across the street with good prices. I also got a great price on my room. I felt very sad that I had to leave after my seven night stay, but I plan to go back again next year for at least another week. The more I see in Venice and the more I read about it, the more there is to see. It was a fantastic trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great Venice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Morganseven
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 2 weeks in Italy, staying at the Hotel da Bruno for 3 nights. Our first-floor room was clean, quiet, very nicely decorated. The staff was helpful and friendly. The breakfast was great. There is a small grocery store on the same street and "Venice's best" gelato shop is right next door! We could not have been happier with this choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the money iin good location”
Reviews.Author: smadaSouthEastEssex
Reviews.Content: Nice clean hotel. Had difficulty finding it, but once got there found it to be central and within easy walking distance of St. Marks Square. Ideal location. Staff friendly. Room was average for European standards but clean and comfortable. Would book here again if returning to Venice. Would not waste money on hotel on the canal. Use restaurants recommended by hotel do not use 'AL Mondo Novo" in the same street as the Da Bruno the food is poor and over priced they also keep the drinks menu out of main menu getting you to order without seeing prices until you have the bill

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel downtown”
Reviews.Author: Vannegen
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from Venice and had stayed at this hotel for 5 days. It's a decent *** hotel that fully deserves this rating. Clean, enough spaciuos (though not really big) rooms, nice staff, good location, decent and varied breakfast. - What else would you expect from a hotel you stay in just to enjoy Venice...? And yet one more thing: really reasonable prices compared to other extremelly overpriced spots in that town. - Piotr (Warsaw, Poland)

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed hotel”
Reviews.Author: ojaidenny
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from a wonderful three week trip to Italy. The Hotel Da Bruno was perfectly located for attractions and shopping in the beautiful city of Venice. The staff were at all times personable and helpful which contributed to making our stay in Venice one of the highlights of our trip. Other reviews pretty much covered everything I would say, but again, we really enjoyed our stay and would highly recommend the hotel Da Bruno. .

Reviews.Title: “Just saw a room and left”
Reviews.Author: Tania_Madrid
Reviews.Content: The hotel where I had the reservation failed to provide me the room (Casa Verardo) and showed me a single room in Da Bruno. What a horrifying site it was, worse than the famous basement of the Austrian Fritzl. It was tiny, there was only a tiny bed and no windows. They wanted almost 200 euros per night for that. I just left with a proper scandal.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back...............”
Reviews.Author: BJAG_FLYER
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from our fourth visit to Venice, staying at Da Bruno on all occasions. We book directly with the hotel, and fly with Ryanair from Stansted to Treviso. Marco Polo airport, served by Easyjet, is closer to Venice proper but we find that the timings aren't quite so convenient. A small (but hopefully useful) piece of advice: Check how long it takes to travel from the airport to the hotel, as you will need to allow this for your return. It's horrible, having just arrived, to be worrying about the journey home, but you won't want to be stranded at Treviso or Marco Polo. However, it's made easier: Coaches are specially timed to coincide with the flights, both inbound and outbound - you simply buy a return ticket to Piazzale Roma (the main bus terminal) when you are still in the airport arrivals hall. The desk is at the end, furthest from the arrivals door (of course !!). You need to validate each ticket in the punching machine at the desk, show it to the coach driver, and retain it for your return journey. This link may be of use: http://europeforvisitors.com/venice/articles/venice_airport_buses.htm You can also purchase multi-use tickets for the Vaporettos (water buses) at the same time, which is extremely convenient to say the least. These similarly need to be validated, but not until the point of boarding your first Vaporetto - just that one time. It's dated and time-stamped at its first use. You then simply present the ticket to an ACTV employee before boarding each Vaporetto to verify its validity. The 72-hour version is good value, but of course it depends on your length of stay. The assistants in the booking desk at the airport arrivals hall will also give you a time-table for your return coach journey. The conveniently-timed airport coaches leave Piazzale Roma from stand D2. Having arrived at the coach drop-off point, make your way across to the Vaporetto landing stages (water-bus stops, basically) and look for the signs for a number 1 or 82 towards The Lido. Your trip towards Da Bruno will be an excellent welcome to the city - you even alight at the famous Rialto Bridge. You may be "herded" at Piazzale Roma by a well-meaning Venetian, but he'll be steering you towards the water-taxis. These are very expensive - the Vaporettos are more fun, too. Just look across the bus-station for the ACTV signs - and the yellow Vaporetto pontoons. Do be advised that the water-buses are the most popular form of transport, well-used by the Venetians, and although we're putting hard-earned money into their economy, they seem to forget it when you're struggling to board with baggage. They give none or very little quarter. They're bad enough with each other, so don't take it personally...... It sounds more complicated than it is, but after a few hours you'll be well acquainted with the system. It works well. Although the hotel is well-placed for the main sights, the Vaporettos offer excellent views of the city and should be made good use of. For your return to the airport, allow about 50 minutes to get from the Hotel Da Bruno to the Piazzale Roma for the coach pick-up to the airport. A No. 2 Vaporetto is a little more direct, as it doesn't stop at so many points along the way. If you are in any doubt, speak to one of the guys at Da Bruno, tell him your flight time and number, and he'll check on the Interweb for the coach connecting time. They vary, depending on season, but for example the 1445 flight from Treviso (May 2008) is served by the 1210 coach from Piazzale Roma. We always find Da Bruno to be more than we need - after all, a visit to Venice isn't about looking at the four walls of a hotel room, is it? The excellent location makes it extremely good value for money - and as other reviewers have said, it is centrally placed between San Marco and Ponte Rialto. Yes, the rooms can be a little shady, but that's the nature of Venice - the narrow alleys do make for shadows. The staff will go that extra mile to make your stay as pleasant as possible, and their love and knowledge of the city means that they can advise on just about everything - you only have to ask. I'd gladly mention some names, but to forget any one of them would be an embarrassment. Suffice it to say that the three-star category of this hotel is a little unkind. If you do stay at the Da Bruno, look out for Igor - he has a brilliant sense of humour, and will look after you very well. As Arnie said: "I'll be back...." David JM.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: johniec
Reviews.Content: Having read many of the reviews of this hotel prior to our visit, I realise how useful Trip Advisor has become to me. Personal experience,not just location or room size, is always going to be the most influential factor in any review.The vast majority of visitors have been very complimentary about this hotel and this is deserved in our party's opinion.-good location,very helpful friendly staff,very good continental breakfast and a very clean refurbished room. However, our rooms had outlooks on to walls and the en suite shower/toilet, whilst immaculately cleaned daily, had a distinctly 'continental' smell ( 138 & 139). We didn't use the air conditioning as it was cold during our stay but the radiator heating was fine. Currently,the pound/euro exchange rate is poor for Brits (even worse for the dollar) making Venice pretty expensive particularly restaurants for evening dinner with wine. It is possible to eat much cheaper than this at Take-Aways and at lunch time in bars and restaurants. Venice is such a great place it is worth finding a way of making it fit your budget! Overall I really liked the hotel but the smell in the room reduced my overall assessment to 'average' from the 'above average' I think the hotel should have got.

Reviews.Title: “Service Supreme”
Reviews.Author: Meesh47
Reviews.Content: I didn't know what to expect because the travelagent said it was small and no elevators but the location was great so I booked it. We were travelling with friends and I hoped that they wouldn't be disappointed because we have stayed in some great hotels. We couldn't have been happier. The hotel owners treated us like family. They were helpful, courteous, the place was spotless and the breakfast was great. We left the Hotel after 3 days because we were going on a cruise so the hotel arranged for a water taxi to take us to our port. It was a good 25 minutes away. We got there and my friend realized that she had left her and her husbands passports locked in the safe back at the hotel in Venice. They will not let you on the ship without your passports!! We called the hotel explained the situation and the hotel went and got the passports, put them in a security envelope and hired a water taxi to bring us the passport! They were just great and they saved our vacation. Hats off to you Hotel da Bruno for the great customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Pickeringcouple
Reviews.Content: Nice clean hotel. Had difficulty finding it, but once got there found it to be central and within easy walking distance of St. Marks Square. Ideal location. Staff friendly. Room was average for European standards but clean and comfortable. Would book here again if returning to Venice. Would not waste money on hotel on the canal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: o5brock
Reviews.Content: What a great, friendly hotel in the heart of venice. Very close to the rialto Bridge and St Marks square. We stayed two nights here and would recommend this hotel to all. On our arrival we were greeted with a glass of orange juice and had our heavy bags carried upstairs for us, even though only one staff member on hand at the time. The service couldn't have been better. Rooms very comfortable and spacious and nicely decorated. The bathrooms are small but this is in line with most of italy. The breakfast was really nice, with a good selection. Complimentary umbrellas for guests as it was raining for most of the time we were there. Would definetely stay there again, great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great little Hotel, perfectly located.”
Reviews.Author: bluespearbone
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel da Bruno for three nights in early March. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Hotel location is ideal for getting out to the sites, being only a few minutes walk from Piazza San Marco and, of course, the buses on the Grand Canal. For the price, this hotel presents excellent value. The breakfast is light continental only which, for personal preference, is the only downside I could find.

Reviews.Title: “the room reviews by travellers are much too flattering”
Reviews.Author: dubaiite
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at Da Bruno last week for two nights. The hotel staff as mentioned before were pleasant and helpful. The rooms left much to be desired. We got a room on the first floor (thankfully) which was facing the busy street (unthankfully). The air conditioning in venice is off till 1st may,by law so imagine trying to sleep with 10000 decibels of noise coming from the street. It was very stuffy in the small room and the bathroom was tiny. It took architectural precision to move around in the bathroom. I would suggest that somewhere, somehow all websites that do online bookings for hotels in venice point out that there is no airconditioning there till 1st May. All in all, I would think twice about suggesting this hotel for its room size and comfort level but definitely suggest it for the welcome orange juice :) and location.

Reviews.Title: “A treasure in the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: CherubLancashire
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a fantastic few days in Venice. A lovely place to see. Da Bruno Hotel is a wonderful, typical Venetian hotel. A treasure in the heart of Venice. We were met with a friendly reception and a welcoming drink of fresh orange juice. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The continental breakfast was a feast to behold! So much to choose from. Two tables overflowing with fresh fruit, cereal and fresh bread rolls - to mention but a few. All washed down with a choice of tea ot coffee. Our room was really nice, spotlessly clean and decorated with beautiful Venetian chandelier and mirrors. The hotel is situated just a stone's throw from San Marco Basilica, the Campanille and the Rialto Bridge. All in all a fantastic place to be. No-one should miss it!

Reviews.Title: “A Little gem”
Reviews.Author: gazzerooni
Reviews.Content: When myself and five of my friends decided to visit Venice for the St. Patrick's weekend, I searched through loads of websites including TA looking for somewhere central yet reasonable. In the end, I settled on Hotel da Bruno as the reviews here were very good and it seemed to be very well situated. Also it was much more reasonably priced than all other places located near St Mark's Square. I booked through Venere.com but emailed da Bruno's to confirm this. They were very quick to reply and confirm which was a very good sign. We arrived on Friday 16th March about eleven in the morning after a very early flight from Dublin. We were all a bit tired and very hungry. We were greeted by a man who was very friendly and professional. We were all checked in very quickly and while we were waiting, we were given complimentary glasses of orange juice- a nice touch. We had to bring up our own luggage up to our rooms but that was no big deal as we all only had small hand luggage for the weekend. When we came down from our rooms, we asked the same concierge about somewhere for lunch. We wanted something light to eat.He said he knew the perfect place. We thought we would get directions but instead he came out with us onto the street and brought us to the restaurant, which was a couple of streets away. It was a lovely place called Canaletto which did great Italian food. It was full of locals who were eating lunch. We got the last big table outside. The meal was very tasty. We all had a beer, a pizza and a coffee and it was only 15 Euros each-very reasonable!!! We ended up getting them to book dinner for the first night.They recommended a place called Trattoria alla Scala on Corte lucatello about five or six minutes away. It was a lovely place with very friendly staff and great food. We really enjoyed it and while it was a bit pricey- 70 euros each for starters, mains, dessert, coffee and wine- it was a very good experience and reasonable for Venice. We went to another restaurant called Trattoria della Remigio on our third night based on great reviews in our guide books. That place is very popular with locals and that is normally a good sign. However when we asked our waiter to help us work out the menu- it was all in Italian- and we all spoke only German, English and French between us- he was very unhelpful and dismissive. He spoke very good English so I think he just did'nt really like tourists. We were all very annoyed as we all either work or have worked in catering and are very easy customers. I had read about this double standard of treatment of tourists and locals but thought it was ever-inflated. Its not. Anyway back to the Hotel da Bruno. The rooms are small and very comfortable. The bathrooms are also small but very clean. Breakfast is served from seven until ten every morning beside the lobby. Its continental in Style but very tasty and a good way to start the day. Most placed I have stayed in Europe charge extra for breakfast so its great that it is included in the price. We were all staying on the first and second floors and all our three rooms were very comfortable. We were all very happy with our experience in the da Bruno. The staff on the front desk were all very friendly and very helpful. They all spoke excellent English which is always a bonus. I would definitely recommend the Hotel da Bruno to anyone looking for somewhere clean and central to stay in Venice. Its also great value and as I said before, staffed by very knowledgeable and helpful people. It is less than five minutes to the Grand Canal and the Rialto bridge and six minutes or so to St Mark's Square .

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but Room was really Shabby”
Reviews.Author: ElsiMM
Reviews.Content: I donâ€™t think it meritâ€™s such high praises as the reviews itâ€™s received. At best, it should get Average but truly it deserves Below Average. Iâ€™m not sure if I had the misfortune of getting a really shabby room. But I canâ€™t say my stay was pleasant. The room was spacious but a bit dreary and dark, decorated in classic Venetian style. It didnâ€™t feel homey and comfortable. The worst part was that the AC blew at best warm air during the hot summer time which made it very unpleasant and the room had a funky odor â€“ like something old, dirty and wet. The room didnâ€™t look dirty, but it just made you feel like it was dirty because of the musky sent. The bathroom in our room was OK. The location and the price for the hotel was great, the reception was OK and the breakfast was very standard. The hotel didnâ€™t have a lift. We had to walk up one flight of stairs with our own luggage. I know that with some European budget hotels you canâ€™t expect luxury, large rooms, elevators, spectacular buffet breakfast and other amenities. But I do expect to have a decent room that makes me feel comfortable to sleep at night â€“ and I felt that Da Bruno was lacking this.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ichronis
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Da Bruno Hotel during Christmas 2006. It was not our first time in Venice but it is the first time we are so content. The hotel cover all the needs of smart travellers who want to get rest in a pleasant hotel and go around. The place is very easy to reach and you can go everywhere in Venice. It is in the hart of Venice. The room we stayed was small but very comfortable. The receptionists are very kind, friendly and helpful. The small price worth it every euro!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Alex.uk-7
Reviews.Content: So close to St Marks Sq, nice and quiet rooms (with venetian glass!), really friendly staff. When you arrive, get the vaporetto to Rialto Bridge - its a beautiful way to arrive (esp. at night). Then it's literally just a few minutes walk to the hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Da Bruno
HotelInfo.Address: Salizzada San Lio 5726 /a Castello, 30122 Venice, Italy
